smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'CameraImpl' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function reloadAppList appears to be too complex.

smells.name: PrintStackTrace
smells.description: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

smells.name: MemberNameEqualsClassName
smells.description: A member should not given the same name as its parent class or object.

instances.message: A member is named after the class. This might result in confusion. Either rename the member or change it to a constructor.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private variable names should match the pattern: (_)?[a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: FunctionMaxLength
smells.description: Function names should not be longer than the maximum set in the project configuration.

instances.message: Function names should be at most 30 characters long.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(activity).getBoolean("event_sms", false) && permissionHelper.smsHasPermission()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(activity).getBoolean("event_sms", false) && permissionHelper.smsHasPermission()

Parentheses in (PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(activity).getBoolean("event_call", false) && permissionHelper.callHasPermission()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(activity).getBoolean("event_call", false) && permissionHelper.callHasPermission()

Parentheses in (PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(activity).getBoolean("settings_contacts", false) && permissionHelper.contactsHasPermission()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: PreferenceManager.getDefaultSharedPreferences(activity).getBoolean("settings_contacts", false) && permissionHelper.contactsHasPermission()
Parentheses in (isPitch()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: isPitch()
Parentheses in (isReversePitch()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: isReversePitch()

Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,Manifest.permission.RECEIVE_SMS) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
            ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,Manifest.permission.RECEIVE_MMS) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,Manifest.permission.RECEIVE_SMS) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
            ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,Manifest.permission.RECEIVE_MMS) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED

Parentheses in (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context, Manifest.permission.READ_CALL_LOG) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
                    ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context, Manifest.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED ) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context, Manifest.permission.READ_CALL_LOG) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED &&
                    ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context, Manifest.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED
Parentheses in (indx - 15) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: indx - 15

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: kotlin.math.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
androidx.room.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: CollapsibleIfStatements
smells.description: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

instances.message: Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.
Two if statements which could be collapsed were detected. These statements can be merged to improve readability.

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function continueEvent has 6 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function contactAllowed has 4 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function getMessage has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
